content.raw:
1. Is there a reason why it isn't `msgs::ConvertJointType` such as on line 1708? Or maybe can `this->` be used here?

2. [This](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=joint#joint_type) SDF specification website doesn't list allowed joint types, but  [here](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/cb779ddd18d4805e10a238afffde7e85426689ae/sdf/1.5/joint.sdf?at=default#cl-10) I found reference to these types: `revolute`, `revolute2`, `prismatic`,  `ball`, `universal`, `piston` - which doesn't correspond exactly to the outputs of `ConvertJointType`. I feel like I've asked about joint types on SDF several times before, is there another source of information which I'm missing?
content.html:
1. Is there a reason why it isn't msgs::ConvertJointType such as on line 1708? Or maybe can this-> be used here?

  2. This SDF specification website doesn't list allowed joint types, but here I found reference to these types: revolute, revolute2, prismatic, ball, universal, piston - which doesn't correspond exactly to the outputs of ConvertJointType. I feel like I've asked about joint types on SDF several times before, is there another source of information which I'm missing?
